subject: Economics
title: Green Tech Economics: Can Innovation Save the Planet?
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Green Tech Economics: Can Innovation Save the Planet?.

hook.text: Solar energy costs dropped 90% in a decade. Wind energy is now cheaper than coal in most of the world.

buildup.text: Green tech follows learning curves: every doubling of solar panel production drops costs by 20%.

discovery.text: The energy transition is now economically inevitable.

twist.text: The transition creates losers: fossil fuel workers, oil-rich nations, and industries built on carbon.

climax.text: Green technology shows that innovation can align environmental and economic interests.

punchline.text: The technology to save the planet already exists. The economics work.

quiz.question: Why has the energy transition become economically inevitable?
options: Learning curves and scale have made renewables cheaper than fossil fuels in most applications
